section.title: Purpose
section.p: EqfCreateControlledFolder creates a new controlled folder by using the specified values. Configure the target drive for the folder using the Configure Drives window of .

row.entry: The EQF session handle, as returned by EqfStartSession.
The name of the folder to be created.
The target drive for the new folder. If omitted, the primary EQF drive is used. The drive must be the primary EQF drive or one of the secondary EQF drives defined in the Configure Drives window.
The name of the Translation Memory to be used for the documents in the new folder.
The name of the markup table, for example EQFMRI.
The name of the editor. If not specified, the editor STANDARD is used.
The list of dictionaries to be used during translation. You can specify up to 10 dictionaries.
The source language for the documents in this folder. Specify the language exactly as it appears in the Language List window, for example English(U.S.).

The target language for the documents in this folder. Specify the language exactly as it appears in the Language List window, for example English(U.S.). The target language must different from the source language.
The export conversion type, or NULL for no conversion.
The list of Translation Memories to search through during translation, or NULL. You can specify up to 4 Translation Memories.
The password to protect the folder against changes. The password can be up to six characters long.
The name of the project coordinator, or NULL.
The e-mail address of the project coordinator, or NULL.
The name of the translator responsible for this folder, or NULL.
The e-mail address of the translator, or NULL.
The product name this folder is assigned to, or NULL.
The product family this folder is assigned to, or NULL.
The name of a similar product this folder is assigned to, NULL.
The product-specific dictionary to be used during translation, or NULL.
The product-specific memory to be used during translation, or NULL.
The previous version number of the product specified above, or NULL.
The actual version number of the product specified above, or NULL.
The number of the shipment, or NULL.
Error code (EQF message number). Use EqfGetLastError to retrieve the complete error information.

example.title: Code sample
